input_text:
Job Title: Python Developer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Python Developer - Remote (US)
About Interviewed AIInterviewed AI is at the forefront of leveraging artificial intelligence to redefine the hiring process. Our SaaS platform empowers organizations to make informed, data-driven hiring decisions, enhancing both efficiency and inclusivity. As a fully remote company, we value innovation, flexibility, and the power of technology to change lives. Join our mission to transform recruitment with your expertise and passion.
Position OverviewWe're on the lookout for a skilled Python Developer to join our engineering team. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and optimizing our AI-powered recruitment platform. Your work will directly contribute to creating user-friendly, scalable solutions that help organizations identify the best talent. As a Python Developer at Interviewed AI, you will collaborate with a team of talented professionals to drive innovation and deliver high-quality software solutions.
Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain various components of our SaaS platform using Python.Work closely with our data science team to integrate machine learning models into the platform.Implement backend services with high reliability and scalability in mind.Participate in code reviews, contributing to maintaining high code quality and best practices.Collaborate with the frontend team to ensure seamless integration and user experience.Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues.
Technical RequirementsStrong proficiency in Python and experience with its major frameworks (e.g., Django, Flask).Familiarity with RESTful API design and implementation.Experience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).Understanding of front-end technologies (e.g., JavaScript, HTML5, CSS) is a plus.Knowledge of Git and version control best practices.Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is highly desirable.Familiarity with CI/CD tools and practices.Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile development environment.
ExperienceMinimum of 3 years of professional experience in Python development.Proven track record of developing scalable, high-availability applications.Experience in the SaaS or technology sector, particularly with AI or machine learning applications, is a plus.
Working HoursThis is a full-time position requiring a commitment to a standard schedule, with options for either 9 AM - 5 PM or 10 AM - 6 PM working hours.
Employment TypeOpen to both contract and regular full-time employment.
Ideal CandidatePassionate about technology and innovation, particularly in AI and machine learning.Self-motivated and proactive, with a strong desire to learn and grow.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Strong communication and teamwork abilities, comfortable working in a remote environment.
At Interviewed AIBy joining Interviewed AI, you become part of a team committed to excellence and innovation. Our Python Developers play a crucial role in our mission, leveraging their skills to impact the future of hiring. We provide a collaborative, inspiring environment where you can grow professionally and make significant contributions. Let's work together to create groundbreaking solutions that change the way the world hires.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Python Developer
output_json.summary: Join Interviewed AI, a leading AI-driven recruitment platform, as a Python Developer.
job_responsibilities: Develop and maintain platform components using Python
Collaborate with data science team on ML model integration
Implement backend services with reliability and scalability
Contribute to high-quality code and best practices
Collaborate with frontend team for seamless integration
benefits: Options for 9 AM - 5 PM or 10 AM - 6 PM
output_json.company_information: Interviewed AI is a SaaS platform empowering organizations to make informed hiring decisions.
